answer: A: Because they have holes and only produce sparkle-and-crackle effects, as seen when the lit device emits sparks and a small ground burn rather than a strong bang.

The speaker describes the Canadian Fire Cracklers as "the lamest" because they have holes and only produce sparkle-and-crackle effects, which is evident from the visual of the lit device emitting sparks and a small ground burn rather than a strong bang. This supports the statement that the Canadian Fire Cracklers are not as effective or impressive as other fireworks.
